title: Card: Rebuild with interactive/non-interactive variants
description:
## Current State
Card always renders as button or anchor element. This is semantically incorrect for non-interactive cards (content containers).

## Current Problems
- Always interactive (`<button>` or `<a>`)
- No static/non-interactive variant
- `grabbed` prop suggests drag functionality that may not be implemented
- Missing semantic HTML options (`<article>`, `<section>`, `<div>`)

## Required Changes
1. **Default to non-interactive** - render as `<div>` or allow `as` prop
2. **Add `interactive` variant** - optionally renders as button/anchor
3. **Clean up props**:
   - Remove or properly implement `grabbed`
   - Add `as` prop support for semantic flexibility
   - Keep `href` for link cards
4. **Update recipe** with visual variants:
   - Default (non-interactive)
   - Interactive (hover/focus states)
   - Possibly: elevated, outlined, filled variants

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Non-interactive card renders as div by default
- [ ] Interactive prop enables button behavior
- [ ] href prop renders as anchor with proper accessibility
- [ ] Polymorphic `as` prop works (article, section, etc.)
- [ ] Visual variants implemented
- [ ] Add Storybook story showing all variants
close_reason: Card rebuilt with interactive/non-interactive variants, polymorphic as prop, and Storybook stories

title: Breadcrumbs: Reassess and rebuild
description:
## Current State
Basic implementation using `<ul>` wrapped in Text component. Uses Link component for navigation items.

## Accessibility Issues
- Should use `<nav>` wrapper with aria-label="Breadcrumb"
- Should use `<ol>` (ordered list) not `<ul>` - breadcrumbs have order
- Current item should have aria-current="page"
- Separator (/) should be aria-hidden

## API Considerations
Current: `items: { id: string; label: string; href?: string }[]`
- Good that href is optional (current page won't have link)
- Consider adding icon support for items
- Consider max-items with collapse for long breadcrumbs

## Required Changes
1. Wrap in `<nav aria-label="Breadcrumb">`
2. Change to `<ol>` from `<ul>`
3. Add aria-current="page" to current item
4. Make separators aria-hidden
5. Review styling/recipe

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Proper semantic HTML (nav > ol > li)
- [ ] Correct ARIA attributes
- [ ] Links work correctly
- [ ] Current item styled differently (no link)
- [ ] Add Storybook story

title: Select: Create component (currently missing)
description:
## Current State
Select component directory may exist but no Select.tsx file found. This is a missing component.

## Architecture Decision
**Build as a wrapper around existing Menu functionality.** This leverages:
- Menu's floating-ui positioning
- Menu's keyboard navigation
- Menu's accessibility features
- Consistent behavior across components

## Implementation Approach
```tsx
// Select wraps Menu with select-specific semantics
<Select value={value} onChange={onChange} placeholder="Select...">
  <SelectOption value="1">Option 1</SelectOption>
  <SelectOption value="2">Option 2</SelectOption>
</Select>
```

## Component Parts (wrapping Menu equivalents)
- **Select** - Wraps Menu, manages selected value state
- **SelectTrigger** - Wraps MenuTrigger, displays selected value or placeholder
- **SelectOption** - Wraps MenuItem, adds selection indicator

## Key Differences from Menu
- Shows selected value in trigger (not just a button label)
- Single selection with value/onChange pattern
- Checkmark or highlight on selected option
- `role="listbox"` instead of `role="menu"`

## Features
- Keyboard navigation (inherited from Menu)
- Typeahead search (inherited from Menu)
- Disabled options
- Error state styling
- Placeholder text when no selection

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Wraps Menu component internally
- [ ] Single-select functionality works
- [ ] Selected value displays in trigger
- [ ] Keyboard accessible (inherited)
- [ ] Matches library visual style
- [ ] Disabled and error states
- [ ] Add Storybook story

title: Tooltip: Convert to floating-ui
description:
## Current State
Custom positioning implementation with ~200 lines of manual positioning logic, viewport detection, and clockwise fallback placement system.

## Required Changes
- Replace custom positioning with `@floating-ui/react`
- Use pattern established in Menu component:
  - `useFloating` hook with `flip()`, `shift()`, `offset()` middleware
  - `FloatingPortal` for proper stacking
  - `autoUpdate` for position tracking
- Add `useHover` and `useFocus` from floating-ui for trigger modes
- Simplify caret positioning using floating-ui's arrow middleware

## Benefits
- Consistent positioning behavior with Menu
- Better edge cases handled automatically
- Less code to maintain
- Accessibility improvements via floating-ui's role hooks

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Tooltip renders correctly in all 12 positions
- [ ] Auto-flips when near viewport edges
- [ ] Caret points correctly
- [ ] Both hover and click triggers work
- [ ] Title + text content displays properly
- [ ] Add Storybook story demonstrating all variants
